name: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania v. John HANNAH, Petitioner

judges: JONES, C. J., and EAGEN, J., dissent.
parties: COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania v. John HANNAH, Petitioner.

opinions.text:
OPINION OF THE COURT
PER CURIAM.
The petition for allocatur is granted. The order of the Superior Court affirming the judgment of sentence is reversed and a new trial is hereby granted. See Commonwealth v. Triplett, 462 Pa. 244, 341 A.2d 62 (1975).
JONES, C. J., and EAGEN, J., dissent.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

attorneys: Mark A. Lublin, Philadelphia, for petitioner.
F. Emmett Fitzpatrick, Dist. Atty., Steven H. Goldblatt, Asst. Dist. Atty., Chief, Appeals Div., Philadelphia, for respondent.
casebody.head_matter:
341 A.2d 68
COMMONWEALTH of Pennsylvania v. John HANNAH, Petitioner.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Decided June 4, 1975.
Mark A. Lublin, Philadelphia, for petitioner.
F. Emmett Fitzpatrick, Dist. Atty., Steven H. Goldblatt, Asst. Dist. Atty., Chief, Appeals Div., Philadelphia, for respondent.
